title: Tony Meola
summary: Antonio Michael "Tony" Meola (/miˈoʊlə/; Italian: [ˈmɛːola]; born February 21, 1969) is an American retired soccer player who played as a goalkeeper. He represented the United States national team at the 1990, 1994, and 2002 World Cups. From 1996 to 2006, he played in Major League Soccer, the U.S. top soccer division, where he obtained multiple honors. Meola is currently a radio host on SiriusXM FC.
